comments.body: Can you explain why this degradation of type safety is required?

The `sign` function actually returns a modified version of the `options` parameter which can be either a string that is parsed into a url object or an object with any properties. The returned object also has arbitrary properties since it depends on how the url is parsed. `Object` could possibly be used instead of `any` but I'm not sure if TypeScript would handle that properly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +31,35 @@}

export function sign(options?: any, credentials?: any): any;
